text:
The job market is hell.

A guide to survive in the era of ChatGPT:

1. Don't "quick apply" to jobs. 

☑ An AI wrote the CV.
☑ Another AI quick applied to 1,000+ jobs.
☑ And at the end, another AI read all of the CVs. 

This is a dead-end, spiraling down more & more.

2. Your Linkedin is your CV.

☑ Personal branding isn't about being personal.
☑ We don't care about your favorite breakfast.
☑ Instead, share your (specific) expertise.

And no, sharing expertise isn't bragging.

1) Identify + 2) solve a problem 3) your future job would love to solve, 4) but shared on Linkedin.

3. How to make a post.

☑ Ask ChatGPT or Perplexity for specific problems to solve in your industry, solved in a specific way.

☑ Go and try it yourself. Did you solve the problem?

☑ Share it.

Do it for 30 days & you'll receive some messages.
Do it for 90 days & you'll get the one dream job.
Do it for 365 days & you'll never apply for jobs.



PS: I know I'm supposed to "be the AI guy".

But I'm also critical. I hate this part of AI.
